byline.original: By LIAM STACK and SEBNEM ARSU
byline.contributor: Liam Stack reported from Cizre, and Sebnem Arsu from Istanbul.

abstract: Cizre Journal; thousands of people fill streets of Cizre, Turkey, to mourn death of local heroine Cicek Botan, Kurdish militant commander who was killed in Iraq on October 10; Botan commanded PKK, which is considered a terrorist organization by Turkey, United States and European Union.
snippet: As progress was being made on political reforms, violence began to spike in the country’s largely Kurdish southeast.
lead_paragraph: As progress was being made on political reforms, violence began to spike in the country’s largely Kurdish southeast.

headline.main: Clashes With Kurds Are Pushing Turkey Back Toward Conflict
headline.print_headline: Clashes With Kurds Are Pushing Turkey Back Toward Conflict
headline.seo: Clashes With Kurdish Rebels Push Turkey Back Toward Conflict
